annotation.spannedText: the highly contagious disease has spread to seven states and two other countries thanks to parents who declined to vaccinate their children

annotation.spannedText: In order to establish herd immunity, between 96% and 99% of the population must be vaccinated

annotation.spannedText: Clearly, MMR vaccination rates in many of the communities that have been affected by this outbreak fall well below the necessary threshold to sustain herd immunity, thus placing the greater population at risk as well

annotation.spannedText: the only way to explain how the measles spread from a single person at Disneyland to 145 people in the U.S. and about a dozen others in Canada and Mexico is that a substantial number of parents have not had their children fully immunized with the measles, mumps and rubella vaccine
